title: Intelligence Analyst
description: All Source Intelligence Analyst 01/2004 – 01/2012 – United States Army – Fort Meade, MD – Work Schedule: Reserves Assembled, integrated, analyzed and disseminated intelligence information collected from tactical, strategic, and technical sources including multispectral, electro-optical data Used computers for analytical tools, database access and networking in an effort to analyze intelligence holdings to identify gaps, and subsequent intelligence collection requirements. Safeguarded classified information, maintained intelligence records and updated the security clearance database for 192 battalion soldiers. Aerial Reconnaissance Multi-Sensor Analyst 12/2009 – 10/2010 – Operation Iraqi Freedom – Task Force Observe Detect Identify Neutralize Conducted combat Aerial Reconnaissance, Surveillance and Target Acquisition operations. Accumulated 360 flight hours and 84 combat missions resulting in the capture of high-value individuals. Wrote mission reports and conducted post flight analysis of video to produce an imagery-derived product. Strategically coordinated with both SIGINT and HUMINT assets in order to advance pattern of life analysis of high-value individuals in an effort to generate actionable targets. Night Watch Intelligence Analyst 09/2006 – 06/2007 – Operation Iraqi Freedom – 13th Sustainment Command Expeditionary Force Served as a geographic area specialist for Multi-National Forces in Western Iraq Directed critical research and input of over 21,400 Main/Alternate Supply Route and Logistical Base significant activity threat incidents into a comprehensive database. Methodically prepared 370 Intelligence Summaries, 24-Hour Graphic Incident Reports of all IED attacks, and Threat Tracker products and responded to ISRs with timely and accurate predictive analysis to brief the Commanding General in support of over 22,600 soldiers from 240 different units including a Brigade Combat Team.

title: Intelligence Analyst
description: Feb 2010 – Sep 2010: Deployed to Afghanistan as Regional Command South-West Trends And Tactics Chief in support of Operation Enduring Freedom, Camp Leatherneck, AFG, 1ST Marine Expeditionary Force/1ST Intelligence Battalion: 1. Established a daily work rotation modeled to meet the Battalion’s Intelligence Requirements (IR) and Request for Information (RFI) 2. Administered classroom instructions regarding Structured Analytical Techniques and Intelligence Community Directives and Managed platoon and company training plans, resulting in increased Marines’ job proficiency and overall amplified the company’s operational readiness. 3. Evaluated performance and provided guidance and feedback to assist Marines in meeting and exceeding expected standards as an Intelligence Analyst and Marine. 4. Tracked high value targets while in direct support of 1st Reconnaissance Battalion, collected data and conducted surveillance of narcotics rings, IED rings (Improvised Explosive Device), and smuggling cartels using theater-level and organic assets. 5. Monitored over 500 hours of live full motion video from Unmanned Ariel Vehicles while directing theater level assets while conducting reconnaissance in Trek Nawa and Marjeh Afghanistan and Cataloged information derived from the surveillance and disseminate the information for over 5,000 Marines to use for assessments and decision making. 6. In Camp Leatherneck, Afghanistan, was the Chief in the Trends and Tactics cell in the Intelligence Operations Center. Cataloged intelligence data of incidents and events that affected U.S., NATO and Afghanistan forces ranging from complex attacks to weapons cache find. 7. Derived intelligent assessments and developed statistical products to support General Officer Mills decision-making in deployment of forces and operations in higher threat areas.

Engaged in multiple meetings with the Mayor of Al Qa’im to assess the current situation of the city; also interacted with the Chief of Police, and the Iraqi Army General responsible for this geographical area. 3. Derived assessments and developed products to support General Officer decision-making in deployment of forces and operations in higher threat areas.

description: • Served as All Source and Humint Analyst and Humint Advisor in support of TF-Warhorse, TF-Ripcord, TF- Blackhawk, TF-Thunder, and TF 2-16 Rangers operational missions for approximately 14 months • Served as Team Lead of a Counter Intelligence Analytical Team (CIAT) in support of Division Level CI/Humint operations in RC-South and RC-East • Served as the Humint Targeting SME for TF-Warhorse and TF-Ripcord. • Developed, created, and maintained the TF-Warhorse and TF-Ripcord High Value Target List • Provided CIED threat network analysis (HVTL) • Researched, developed and created approximately 107 Humint Target packets, which directly resulted in the Capture/Kill of approximately 39 named High Value Individuals (HVI’s) • Provided All-Source and Humint Analysis in support of approximately 84 named Objective operations in RC-South and RC-East • Provided analysis in tasking the 385th MP BN Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance assets in order to maximize their assets capabilities on the battlefield. • Created, updated, maintained, and briefed the weekly 385th MP BN Targeting slides • Created, updated, maintained and briefed the weekly 385th MP BN Humint assessment slides • Provided daily All-Source and Humint Analytical assessments for TF-Warhorse, TF-Ripcord, TF- Blackhawk, TF-Thunder, and TF 2-16 Rangers • Responsible for the TF 2-16 Rangers daily Ground Intelligence Summary ( GRINTSUM) • Conducted HUMINT Source validation and Source de-confliction • Conducted approximately 82 source validation boards (SVB's)

description: Served as Operational Management Team Leader (NCOIC) in charge of five, four man HUMINT Teams • Served as HUMINT Team Leader in charge of four soldiers • Served as the United States Army Europe (USEUAR) /66MI BDE Collection Analysis Management Operations Seminar NCOIC with approximately 60 Multi National participants • A company. 2D MI VBS2 NCOIC for approximately three years and created and assisted in the development of approximately 100 strategic and tactical training scenarios for VBS2 to include Unexploded Ordinance (UXO), Medical Evacuation Operations, Counter Individual Explosive Device (IED), IED Defeat, Convoy Operations, Vehicle Recovery, and Squad Tactics. • Served as a Human Intelligence Team Leader • Provided Strategic and Tactical debriefing and questioning training and mentorship to over 40 soldiers • Conducted and reported on the debriefings of human sources for approximately 12 months and used debriefing strategies to collect intelligence and integrate the derived information into the order of battle operations • Provided HUMINT analysis to ISAF forces throughout the Zabul province in regards to IED threats, Counter-IED mission planning, target development, damage assessment and counter- terrorism. • Debriefed, Tactically Questioned, or Interrogated over 250 sources, EPW's, or detainees in a seven month period while deployed to Afghanistan in support of NATO and ISAF that resulted in the production of approximately 120 Intelligence reports that answered numerous Theatre level Intelligence requirements • Established and maintained an Infantry Company’s Intelligence Support Team (COIST) • Created and presented over 150 HUMINT training classes to include elicitation, tactical questioning, interrogations, military source operations, detainee operations, rapport building, and approach strategies

title: Chief Special Investigator,
company: The Award Winning BLACKHAWK Investigative and Protection Specialists.
description: Mr Radetich served in the United States Air Force as a Air Policeman and as a member of the San Mateo County Sheriff's Office, CA. Rising to a top supervisor as a highly commended and decorated Sheriff's Sergeant One. He currently is the Chief Special Investigator of the Award Winning BLACKHAWK Investigative and Protection Specialists of Danville, CA. Based in Silicon Valley areas of the San Francisco Bay Region. The BLACKHAWK Specialists is an Investigative, Security and Protection private business. Using highly trained former Military and Law Enforcement Investigators with Intelligence gathering experience as Agents. In the Private, Public and Government sectors with clients from LinkedIn, other referrals and contacts. No government web sites, public communications or social media are used to ensure the privacy of our clients. Do to the nature and sensitivity of the projects. The Specialists may be required to operate some of these assignments covertly. Chief Radetich maintains current expertise by attending academic and legal seminars. Reviewing updated training with input from managerial and administrative peers. He participates in current team physical, weapons training, procedures on Investigative and Protection tactics. The Specialist's consults with their highly confidential clients on protection, security and investigative matters. The gathering of Intelligence, managing investigations and surveillance Op's. Assisting clients with fraud, financial crimes, anti-victimization programs and special event security issues. Meeting with public safety, legal representatives on the reduction and elimination of liabilities and the implementation of protective measures. Chief Radetich is a descendant of a Slavic immigrant Father and a Spanish Mother. He works pro bono advocating for the elderly, families, women and children that are victims of domestic violence, abuse and other felony crimes.
name: Ron Radetich

title: Vice President of The Board of Directors, Ret.
company: City of San Ramon Arts Foundation.
description: As the Vice President of the Board of Directors Mr Radetich developed and recommended a revenue source stream, management program and budget financial plan. From within San Ramon Mr Radetich recruited and recommended a Female Business Owner, Hispanic Female Business CEO. From Danville he recruited and recommended a Senior Financial Campaign Facilitator and Political Business leader for appointments to the Board of Director's. As the Chief Operations Officer Mr Radetich advised the President on safety, security intelligence and protection matters. On major event management, planning and coordination of security resources. Providing close liaison with the Arts Foundation's Executive Board of Directors. The San Ramon City Council, the Mayor, Chief of Police, Fire Chief, Public Work's Director and the press-media representatives. Vice President Radetich's suggestions and recommendations were all approved unanimously by the Arts Foundation's Executive Board of Directors. Awarded a Certificate of Achievement and Appreciation from the President and the Executive Board. For the extra efforts taken to advance the Role of the San Ramon Arts Foundation in the San Ramon Valley. Mr. Radetich continues to support non-profit organizations in the San Francisco Bay Area and the California Central Valley.

title: Court Appointed Special Child Advocate (CASA) and Adult Mentor.
description: Child Advocate and Adult Mentor: Mr Radetich was sworn in by Honorable Superior Court Presiding Judge Marta Diaz. As a Court Appointed Special Child Advocate. Advised CASA Director Patricia Miljanich on her development plan to establish a CASA Program in San Mateo County. To bring in revenue resources benefiting the program and focusing the much needed quick assistance to the children through out San Mateo County. Mr Radetich selected a little boy from East Palo Alto, California to Advocate for and help. The child has Cerebal Palsy and suffered severe blunt force trauma injuries as a small child. Until he was rescued from the home by San Mateo County Deputy Sheriffs. The brutality caused life long disabilities and scaring to his body. He succeeded from the anguish of it all through his religious commitment, support given to him by the medical teams, special education teachers, foster parents, His Advocate-Mentor and from Presiding Judge Marta Diaz. This has been the worst case of Blunt Force Trauma inflicted on a small child in San Mateo County History to date. Mr Radetich advocated for him from elementry school through junior high school and high school. Until the end of his court wardship and the foster care system at age18. Then became his Adult Mentor continuing with locating independent living, employment, education guidance after his graduation from Burlingame High School with a Diploma. He entered College and was elected twice as a Senator and was the First Disabled African American man to be elected Student Body President in the College District's history. He graduated with a Associate of Arts Degree from Canada College of Redwood City, CA on May 25, 2013. He is continuing his journey forward in the completion of his career and higher education goals. Mr Radetich supports the CASA programs in Northern California.
name: Ron Radetich

title: Sheriff's Sergeant One ret.
company: San Mateo County Sheriff's Office, California.
description: Positions Held: Deputy Sheriff, Jailer, Bailiff, Field Training Deputy, Juvenile Investigator, Criminal Detective, Managing Detective Sergeant, Sheriff's Sergeant One and Night Watch Commander. Assignments: Courts and Corrections: Old Main Jail, Men's Medium Security Jail & Honor Camp, Women's Jail & Honor Camp, Work Furlough Facility, Brendan P. Maguire Jail and Manager of the Sheriff's San Mateo County Superior Court Security Bureau. County Wide Patrol Division: Night Watch Commander of all the San Mateo County & Coast side Patrol beats, the San Francisco International Airport beat, City of East Palo Alto beats and contract City beats. Sheriff's E.S.U. : 1964-1980'S A Tactical Deputy & Squad Sergeant with the Helicopter Sergeant, K-9 Sergeants, SWAT Sergeants, Bomb Sergeants, other Squad Sergeants, search & rescue teams and Reserve Forces. Assisting Captain Herb Elvander in his consolidation of all the Special Forces Teams into the first Sheriff's Emergency Services Unit (E.S.U.). Deployed to (HLS) alerts, rescues, bombings, riots, revolts and militant insurrections, to mutual aid requests in San Mateo County and into the Cities of San Francisco, Oakland and other Bay Area Counties Detective Division: Juvenile Investigation Bureau. Investigating crimes against Youth, Children, Infants and crimes committed by Youths. Investigator. Detective Division: East Palo Alto Bureau. Investigating Major Crime, Narcotics, Gangs, Business and Residential crimes, school and youth crimes. As a Juvenile Investigator, Adult Criminal Detective and Managing Detective Sergeant. Detective Division: General Works Detail. Special Investigations of Vice, Arson's, Haz-Mat, Fraud-Financial Crimes and Elderly Abuse. Managing Detective Sergeant. Night Watch Commander: At the North County Jail, Women's Jail & Honor Camp, The Old Main Jail, Men's Medium Security Jail & Honor Camp, all the County Wide Patrol Division's Beats, in the City of East Palo Alto and the Contract Cities.

title: Founding Member, Developer and Negotiator.
company: The Organization of Deputy Sheriff's of the County of San Mateo.
description: Union Organizer: Deputy Sheriff Radetich was one of the Five Founding Deputy Sheriff's. That managed the development, implementation and organization of the first law enforcement union in the San Mateo County government. It was named the "Organization of Deputy Sheriff's (O.D.S)" of San Mateo County. Researched the San Francisco Police Officers Association, Alameda County Deputy Sheriffs Association, Oakland Police Officers Association, Los Angeles Police & Los Angeles County Deputy Sheriff's Association's by-laws and policies. With input from Deputy Sheriffs edited the first by-laws, organizational rules and policies for the O.D.S. Deputy Radetich was appointed by the O.D.S President and Board of Directors to the position of Negotiator on the first Bargaining Team. Meeting for several years with the County Representatives. The O.D.S negotiated and won improved working conditions, with the first equal pay and benefits for all the Female Deputy Sheriff's. Increased all salaries equal to that of the top three Sheriff's and Police agencies in the nine (9) San Francisco Bay Area Counties. The O.D.S. negotiated and won over time pay, premium pay for Post intermediate and advanced certified Deputies, night shift hard ship pay, 12 hour shift pay increment, Detective assignment extra pay and improved the Medical Plan and Dental programs. The O.D.S became one of the top Sheriff's-Police Unions in the state and country. Later renamed the San Mateo County Deputy Sheriff's Association (D.S.A). The ODS Founding Fathers spirit and the original member's hard work and acheivements are being perpetuated by the present DSA President, Board of Directors and the current membership. Mr Radetich continues to support the women and men serving in the most dangerous and important positions in Law Enforcement and the Military Police. Those now actively serving in the front lines on the streets, in the Jails, in the Courts and in Combat Zones around the world.
name: Ron Radetich

title: Sheriff's Superior Court Security Manager.
description: Sheriff's Sergeant Radetich managed the Security and Protection for 32 Superior Court Judges and Commissioners. Supervised 32 Bailiff's and over 10 extra help Deputy Sheriff's. Providing Protection for the Hall of Justice's Superior Court floors and the four satellite Court facilities in Northern, Central, South County and the Juvenile Court facility. Maintaining the State and Federal Bureau of Prison's Standards of Approval for the Federal and State prisoners held for lengthy felony jury trials. A Graduated from the Court Security School at Las Vegas, Nevada. Instructed by Federal and State Court Judges, Prosecutors, Court Security Experts and Administrators. Sergeant Radetich was on the Design team for the Court-Transportation Office. Computer and communications systems. Which linked each Bailiff and roving Security Transportation Deputy Sheriff's with contact directly to the HOJ Security Center and Sheriff's Radio. Sergeant Radetich designed and implemented the first training seminar instructed by guest Court Security Experts and Staff. Mandatory for all command staff, Bailiff's and prisoner transportation Deputy Sheriff's. Updated court room legal procedures, safety, alarm systems, prisoner control, cuffing, searches, and transportation. Court room security and protection tactic's, weaponry uses and security procedures. Escape responses, high risk trial protocol's. Reviewed the procedure for hidden restraints, the security chair use for potentially violent and high escape risk prisoners in jury trials. Sergeant Radetich updated procedures for the top publicized and controversial jury trials. Including the change of venue high risk Federal and State prisoners sent to the Sheriff for murder and serious Felony jury trials. Completing the revision and updates for the Court Security Operations Manual. Resulting in no injuries to the Public, Judges, Commissioners, Bailiff's, Transportation Deputy Sheriff's Court Staff and with no prisoner escapes.
name: Ron Radetich

title: United States Air Force, Air Policeman.
description: As a young teenager with parental consent Mr. Radetich enlisted into the United States Air Force as an Airman. This changed his life and began his career in security, protection and police enforcement. A graduate from the United States Air Force, Air Policeman training program. Air Policeman Radetich was assigned to Air Force Bases in California, Mississippi and to a Strategic Air Command(SAC) base in the State of Kansas. As part of the Tactical Air Base Defense Team protecting Secret Security locations of Armed Aircraft Bombers on standby alert, the Nuclear Weapons storage sites. Public Safety and Protection of the Air Force Officers, Sergeants, Airman, Military families and civilian employees. Assigned to All Law Emforcement duties on the Air Force Base. In the surrounding Air Force community and housing neighborhoods. In the neighboring City of Wichita, Kansas performed Town Patrol duties teamed with the Police Patrols and Sedgwick County Sheriff's Patrols to patrol in the high crime rated civilian-military zones. Patrolling together in squads on foot and in "Patty Wagons". Responding to in progress crimes and quelling civilian-military major disturbances and black-white racial riots. Patrolled the Air Base perimeter on neighboring rural roads with the Sedgwick County Sheriff's Patrol. Performed high speed reduction and traffic enforcement on the Air Base's outer access roads leading to and from the nearby State Highway and Freeway's with the Kansas State Highway Patrol Troopers. Air Policeman Radetich successfully completed four (4) years of service, received good ratings, the GC Medal and was Honorably Discharged.
